evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On February 7, 2025, President Trump named Office of Management and Budget Director Russell Vought as the Acting Director of the CFPB.

extracted.value: President Trump named Russell Vought as Acting Director of CFPB on February 7, 2025

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On February 8, the day after he became Acting Director, Vought instructed CFPB employees via an all-hands email to '[s]tand down from performing any work task.'

extracted.value: Vought instructed CFPB employees to 'stand down' from all work tasks via all-hands email on February 8, 2025

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Vought notified the Board of Governors that, as Acting Director, he was requesting $0 for the third quarter of fiscal year 2025. ... Vought closed the letter by, among other things, committing to 'cut this excessive [reserve] fund.'

extracted.value: Vought requested $0 funding for CFPB's third quarter of fiscal year 2025 and intended to transfer the Bureau's reserve fund to the Federal Reserve

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: Also on February 9, Vought said that the CFPB has been 'a woke and weaponized agency against disfavored industries and individuals for a long time.' ... the Bureau’s D.C. headquarters would be closed from February 10 through February 14.

extracted.value: Vought closed CFPB's D.C. headquarters from February 10-14, 2025, and publicly stated CFPB was 'a woke and weaponized agency'

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: On February 10, after Vought announced that the CFPB would not be drawing funds for the third quarter in light of its supposed reserves of $711 million, Elon Musk posted on social media, 'CFPB has $711M? That money should be returned to taxpayers.'

extracted.value: Elon Musk publicly supported defunding CFPB with social media posts including 'CFPB has $711M? That money should be returned to taxpayers.'
